benchmark_details.name: EGOILLUSION
benchmark_details.overview: EGOILLUSION is a first benchmark to evaluate MLLM hallucinations in egocentric videos, comprising 1,400 videos paired with 8,000 human-annotated open and closed-ended questions designed to trigger hallucinations in both visual and auditory cues.

purpose_and_intended_users.goal: To systematically evaluate hallucination in MLLMs across a diverse set of egocentric video-language tasks.

data.source: Curated primarily from the VideoRecap and Ego4D datasets.
data.annotation: Human annotation with expert oversight was employed.

methodology.calculation: Accuracy is computed as the primary metric where lower accuracy indicates a higher degree of hallucinations.
methodology.interpretation: Lower accuracy reveals a greater susceptibility to hallucinations.
methodology.baseline_results: The best performance achieved by models on EGOILLUSION was 59% accuracy.
methodology.validation: Extensive analysis of the modelsâ€™ responses to uncover insights about hallucination tendencies.
